original: Bjurström, Tor Sigurd, konstnär, Göteborg, f. 13/7/88 i Sthlm av gro-ss-handl. Gustaf B. o. Matilda Johansson. G. m. Vera Crone. Barn: Jesper o. Johan Frederik. — Stud. v. konstn:-förb. sk. i Sthlm, h. Zartmann i Köpenhamn samt i Paris. Stud:res. t. Norge, Danm., Holl., Belg., Engl. o. Frankr. Lär. v. Valands målarsk. i Gbg 20-29, intend. h. Gbgs konstfören. 36. Har utf. glasmåln. i sv. kyrkan i Paris, fresk i Gbgs stadsteater, landskap, porträtt, motiv fr. Bohuslän, blomsterstycken m. m. Utst. v. De ungas utstärin. i Sthlm 09-11, m. De åtta 12, utställn. i Köpenhamn 16, v. jub lutställn. i Gbg 23, v. världsut-ställn. i Paris 37, sep :utställn. i Gbg 21, 28, 31, 33, 39, 43 o. 46, i Sthlm 29, 37, 42 o. 44, i Malmö 32 o. 45, i Gävle 45 o. i Borås 42. Repr. i Nat :mus. i Sthlm, konstmus. i Gbg, i Malmö, Borås o. Gävle mus. samt i Stat. mus. f. Kunst i Köpenhamn. Led. av statens konstråd 40-43 o. 43-46, led., av konstinkmdn v. Gbgs konstmus. sed. 23, led. av styr. f. KRO. RVO.
translated: Bjurström, Tor Sigurd, artist, Gothenburg, born July 13th, 1888 in Stockholm to wholesale merchant Gustaf B. and Matilda Johansson. Married to Vera Crone. Children: Jesper and Johan Frederik. Studied at the Association of Art Schools in Stockholm, with h. Zartmann in Copenhagen, and in Paris. Traveled for study to Norway, Denmark, Holland, Belgium, England, and France. Taught at Valand painting school in Gothenburg from 1920 to 1929, intended for Gothenburg Art Society in 1936. Has executed stained glass in the Swedish church in Paris, frescoes in Gothenburg City Theatre, landscapes, portraits, motifs from Bohuslän, flower pieces, and more. Exhibited at The Young's Exhibition in Stockholm from 1909 to 1911, with The Eight in 1912, exhibition in Copenhagen in 1916, the jubilee exhibition in Gothenburg in 1923, the world exhibition in Paris in 1937, separate exhibitions in Gothenburg in 1921, 1928, 1931, 1933, 1939, 1943, and 1946, in Stockholm in 1929, 1937, 1942, and 1944, in Malmö in 1932 and 1945, in Gävle in 1945, and in Borås in 1942. Represented in National Museum in Stockholm, art museums in Gothenburg, Malmö, Borås, and Gävle, as well as in the State Museum of Art in Copenhagen. Member of the State Art Council from 1940 to 1943 and from 1943 to 1946, a member of the Art Committee for Gothenburg Art Museum since 1923, and a member of the board for KRO. RVO.

education.name: Association of Art Schools in Stockholm

creativeWork.name: Stained glass in the Swedish church in Paris
